results.name: Difference between largest n-digit prime and smallest (n+1)-digit prime.
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8000 (terms 1..1000 from Pierre CAMI, terms 1001..4000 from Robert G. Wilson v)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Next Prime.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Previous Prime.
example: 7 = greatest prime with 1 digit, 11 next smallest prime with 2 digits so a(1)=4.
97 = greatest prime with 2 digits, 101 next smallest prime with 3 digits so a(2)=4.
results.author: _Jeff Burch_
ext: Corrected and edited by _Patrick De Geest_, Nov 06 2004
